resources.string: This android application displays nearby bus timing information and bus routes that JUTC operates. This application utilizes the GPS built in to your smart phone to pinpoint your location. The application will then tie you to the nearest bus stop and display a list of the buses arriving at that bus stop in the order of arrival time.

string-array.name: questions
string-array.item: 1. What does the Acronym JUTC mean?
2. What is the JUTC SMART CARD?
3. What is the size and “make up” of the JUTC fleet?
5. How much does the SmartTransit Application cost?
6. Where does the SmartTransit Application work?

string-array.name: answers
string-array.item: This is a “cashless system” of bus fare payment, which JUTC commuters can use for travel within the Kingston Metropolitan Transportation Region (KMTR). The card is reusable and rechargeable and should not be thrown away – similar to a credit card.
The fleet size is now approximately 460 buses and including the artic, bi-artic, buses for the handicapped and luxury coaches. The most common make in the fleet is Volvo.
The JATransit app was designed by 5 Students from the Department of Computing at the UWI, Mona. Namely: Anthony Scott, Caliph Cole, Percival Reid, Antoinette Todd and Herbert McNeil
The JATransit application is completely free to everyone with an Android Smartphone.
The JATransit application is intended to work in the areas of Jamaica served by scheduled JUTC bus service.
